description: President Donald Trump says he thinks his "voice should be heard" when it comes to making recommendations on the interest rates set by the Federal Reserve. He speaks with reporters in the Oval Office. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Says He Should Have a Role in Talking to the Fed on Rates

description: Miriam Vogel, Equal AI President & CEO discusses President Trump signing an executive order to limit state-level regulations, and suggests this order will impact existing state laws & those being crafted. Vogel also talks about still being in the early days of AI, the concerns people might have with this technology, and how AI is creating workforce displacement. She speaks with Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg’s “Balance of Power.” (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Court's Will Determine A Lot of AI Regulation: Vogel

description: House Democrats have released a tranche of new photos from the estate of the late Jeffrey Epstein that include President Donald Trump, former President Bill Clinton, Bill Gates, Steve Bannon and Larry Summers. The photographs are undated, and show Trump before he became president. Andrew Mountbatten Windsor, King Charles III’s brother, is also pictured. White House spokeswoman Abigail Jackson criticized Democrats for the “cherry-picked photos with random redactions to try and create a false narrative.” Trump has repeatedly said he cut ties with Epstein nearly two decades ago and was not aware of the late financier’s activities. Bloomberg News Senior Investigative Reporter Jason Leopold joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump, Clinton, Bannon Included in Release of Epstein Photos

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Travelers would have to provide their social media history.
title: Trump Administration Plan Would Add New Hurdles for Foreign Visitors

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec discuss Fed officials split over risks to the US economy heading into 2026. Bloomberg's Michael McKee joins the show to break it down. Also on today's show, Robinhood Markets Chief Investing Officer Stephanie Guild examines retail trading trends, and UIPath CFO & COO Ashim Gupta talks AI and automation, and his company's work with the US government. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Oracle Delays OpenAI Data Centers, Broadcom Under Pressure | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 12/12/2025

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said that Kevin Hassett and Kevin Warsh are his top choices to lead the US Federal Reserve and that he expects the next chair of the central bank to consult with him on interest rates.
title: Trump Names Warsh, Hassett as Top Fed Chair Contenders, WSJ Says

description: UIPath, a robotics automation software company, has seen its shares rise close to 40% this year due in large part to the company's large customer base over several industries, spanning from healthcare to the US government. CFO & COO Ashim Gupta joined Carol Massar, Tim Stenovec, and Nina Trentmann on 'Bloomberg businessweek Daily' to discuss AI and automation trends.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Analysts Raise UiPath Price Targets Post-Earnings

author: Laura Curtis, Greg Stohr
description: Companies eager for relief from President Donald Trump’s tariffs are likely to have to wait until at least January.
title: Importers Await Tariff Relief as Supreme Court Adjourns for Year

description: Oracle Corp. has pushed back the completion dates for some of the data centers it’s developing for the artificial intelligence model developer OpenAI to 2028 from 2027, according to people familiar with the work. The delays are largely due to labor and material shortages, said the people, asking not to be identified discussing private schedules. Oracle has been working to deliver on a $300 billion contract to supply the computing power necessary to train and run OpenAI’s models since it was inked this summer. Even with the delays, the timelines for the projects in the US remain ambitious for sites that are set to become some of the largest in the world. Brody Ford discusses his reporting on Oracle's position at the center of the AI book on Bloomberg Businessweek Daily. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Oracle’s $300B AI Bet Becomes Bubble Barometer

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondents Joe Mathieu discusses the latest from DC. On today's show, Democratic Congressman Jim McGovern, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis, Harvard Kennedy School's Ash Center Visiting Democracy Fellow Jeanne Sheehan Zaino and Anchorage Digital CEO Nathan McCauley. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Ups Pressure on Venezuela | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/12/2025

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: The Internal Revenue Service uncovered $10.6 billion in financial crimes — a nearly 16% increase from the year prior — even as it deployed agents to Trump administration law enforcement priorities far beyond their usual remit.
title: IRS Finds $10.6 Billion in Crimes as Agents Ramp Up Warrants

description: A group of states are suing the Trump administration over its $100,000 application fee for a new H-1B visa. It lets skilled foreign workers into the US. The suit says the fee creates a costly and illegal barrier for employers. The White House calls the fee lawful and necessary. Jeanne Sheehan Zaino and Rick Davis discuss on "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: States Suing Over Trump's $100,000 H-1B Visa Fee

description: President Donald Trump is expected have his administration move to reclassify marijuana as a less dangerous drug, according to people familiar with the matter. This has been good news for pot stocks. Nathan Dean of Bloomberg Intelligence has more.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Expected to Label Pot a Less Dangerous Drug

author: Daniel Flatley
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said his department will enhance scrutiny of funds heading to Somalia outside of the traditional banking system, potentially stepping up pressure on a nation President Donald Trump has regularly disparaged.
title: Treasury to Scrutinize Cash for Somalia as Trump Slams Nation

description:
Five cryptocurrency firms received preliminary approval to perform certain banking functions from a US regulator on Friday, marking the latest step in the White House‘s embrace of what was once viewed as a risky, fringe industry.
The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency offered conditional approval for national trust bank charters that Circle Internet Group Inc., Ripple, BitGo Inc., Fidelity’s digital assets arm and Paxos had requested, according to a press release.

Nathan McCauley, Co-Founder and CEO of Anchorage Digital joins to discuss. 
Anchorage Digital Bank was the first crypto company to get a national trust charter back in 2021 (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Five Crypto Firms Get Coveted US Bank-Charter Nod

author: Emily Birnbaum, Hadriana Lowenkron, Michael Shepard
description: White House AI czar David Sacks defended President Donald Trump’s push to rein in state-level regulation of artificial intelligence over objections from Democrats, saying the move seeks to ease a growing compliance burden for companies.
title: White House AI Czar Defends Trump Push to Rein in State Rules

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: A group of states announced they are suing the Trump administration to block a $100,000 fee for any new applications for H-1B visas, which allow employers in the US to hire skilled foreign workers.
title: States to Sue Trump Over $100,000 Fee for H-1B Visa Applications

author: Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union approved extending an EU freeze on Russian assets using emergency powers, a key step toward tapping the funds to help Ukraine.
title: EU Approves Extending Freeze on Russian Assets to Help Ukraine War Efforts

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: The US Treasury Department lifted sanctions on Brazil Supreme Court Judge Alexandre de Moraes as the nations continue to repair ties that frayed over the prosecution of former President Jair Bolsonaro earlier this year.
title: US Lifts Sanctions on Brazil Judge Who Led Bolsonaro Trial

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: The US envoy to the United Nations blamed Rwanda for an ongoing rebel advance in the Democratic Republic of Congo that cast fresh doubt on a tenuous peace accord overseen by President Donald Trump earlier this month.
title: US Accuses Rwanda of Backing Rebels Shredding Trump’s Peace Deal

author: Shruti Srivastava, Jorge Valero
description: Trade negotiators from India and the European Union are no longer optimistic they can finalize a trade agreement by the end of the year, with talks stuck on a few key issues like steel and automobiles, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU and India Unlikely to Finalize Trade Agreement by End of Year

author: Will Standring
description: Reform UK has surpassed Labour to become Britain’s largest party by membership, in the latest illustration of how its leader, Nigel Farage, is upending the country’s political landscape.
title: Farage’s Reform Overtakes Labour as Largest UK Party by Members

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: House Democrats have released a tranche of new photos from the estate of the late Jeffrey Epstein that include President Donald Trump, former President Bill Clinton, Bill Gates, Steve Bannon and Larry Summers.
title: Trump, Clinton, Bannon Included in Release of Epstein Photos

author: Emily Mason, Katanga Johnson
description: Five cryptocurrency firms received preliminary approval to perform certain banking functions from a US regulator on Friday, marking the latest step in the White House‘s embrace of what was once viewed as a risky, fringe industry.
title: Five Crypto Firms Get Coveted US Bank-Charter Nod

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Courtney Subramanian
description: President Donald Trump said Thailand and Cambodia have agreed to stop fighting, after speaking with the leaders of the two countries to urge them to end the “very unfortunate reawakening of their long-running War.”
title: Trump Says Thai, Cambodian Leaders Agreed to Fresh Ceasefire

author: Andrea Palasciano, Michael Nienaber, Alberto Nardelli
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will travel to Berlin on Monday to meet with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and other European leaders, including UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer, to press forward talks on US-led peace proposals.
title: Zelenskiy to Meet Europeans in Berlin to Discuss Peace Plan

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russia is attempting to disrupt European Union plans to use its frozen assets to help Ukraine’s war effort as the two sides tussle for advantage ahead of possible peace talks.
title: Russia Sends EU a Warning Over Assets as Pressure Mounts on Kyiv

description:
Venezuela is under continuing financial pressure from the Trump administration. Now the US has sanctioned three of Nicolas Maduro’s nephews as well as six oil tankers. Bloomberg's Tyler Kendall reports. 

 (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Sanctions Maduro's Nephews and Six Oil Tankers

author: Gregory Korte, Marcelo Rochabrun
description: President Donald Trump intends to designate Peru as a major non-NATO ally, another sign of his outreach to Latin American partners as the administration escalates its campaign against Venezuela and alleged narco-terrorists.
title: Trump to Name Peru a Major Non-NATO Ally Amid Anti-Drug Push

description: A group of influential Swiss lawmakers proposed watering down the capital demands that the country wants to impose on UBS Group AG, sending shares to a 17-year high as investors bet the initiative will ultimately pave the way for a compromise. UBS had said the original plan could hurt the bank and economy. Bloomberg's Sridhar Natarajan reports.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: UBS Shares Surge as Lawmakers Push for Weaker Capital Rules

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The Pentagon’s troubled V-22 Osprey program has seen its accident rate steadily increase in recent years, according to a new report from congressional auditors, despite heightened scrutiny after a series of deadly mishaps.
title: V-22 Osprey Accidents Rose In Last Two Years, Watchdog Says

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: President Donald Trump’s administration is preparing to turn to private businesses to help mount offensive cyberattacks against foreign adversaries, according to people familiar with the matter, potentially expanding a shadowy electronic conflict typically conducted by secretive intelligence agencies.
title: Trump Administration Turning to Private Firms in Cyber Offensive

author: Matthew Griffin, Janet Freund, Jordan Fitzgerald
description: An upcoming US Supreme Court ruling on the legality of the sweeping tariffs that President Donald Trump rolled out in April — briefly sending markets worldwide into a tailspin — could be the next test for stocks that have been flying high.
title: The Stocks to Watch When Supreme Court Rules on Trump’s Tariffs

description:
The Duckhorn Portfolio is among North America’s premier luxury wine companies, with a history dating back nearly 50 years. The company's wines are available throughout the United States, on five continents, and in more than 50 countries around the world.
Robert Hanson was named CEO of The Duckhorn Portfolio early 2025. He discusses some of Duckhorn's newest offerings, and details plans for its next era of growth with Alexis Christoforous, Kristine Aquino and Bailey Lipschultz on Bloomberg Businessweek Daily. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Duckhorn CEO Touts Quality as Popular Wine Brand's Key Driver

author: Andra Timu, Irina Vilcu
description: The European Union’s top prosecutor joined calls for Romania to clean up its judiciary after a report over suspected corrupt rulings favoring the ruling elite, adding another potentially divisive issue to the agenda of the country’s fractious coalition government.
title: EU Top Prosecutor Joins Call for Romania to Clean Up Judiciary

author: Nathan Risser
description: New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy declared a state of emergency effective Friday over a potential propane shortage for home and commercial heating after a service disruption at a major plant in Pennsylvania.
title: New Jersey Declares State of Emergency Over Propane Supply

author: Nicolle Yapur, Fabiola Zerpa, Patricia Laya
description: Venezuela faces a fresh financial shock after the US seized a sanctioned oil tanker off its coast, a move that could choke off one of the few remaining revenue streams for a nation again on the brink of hyperinflation.
title: US Seizure of Venezuela Oil Tanker Risks Amping Up Economic Pain

author: Iain Rogers
description: Germany’s foreign ministry summoned the Russian ambassador in Berlin and made it clear there’ll be consequences for hybrid attacks backed by the government in Moscow aimed at undermining democracy.
title: Germany Summons Russia Envoy Over ‘Massive’ Rise in Cyberattacks

author: Jorge Valero, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: The European Union will impose higher fees on small packages starting next year in an attempt to curb the influx of parcels coming mostly from China.
title: EU Agrees to Interim €3 Levy on Small Parcels to Combat China

author: S'thembile Cele
description: South African Deputy President Paul Mashatile signaled to the Democratic Alliance that he wants it to remain in any future coalition government, as part of a broader effort to position himself as President Cyril Ramaphosa’s eventual successor.
title: South Africa’s Mashatile Woos DA as Part of Leadership Campaign

author: Jorgelina Do Rosario, Sergio Mendoza
description: Bolivia’s new government is drawing up plans to slash subsidies that give its drivers some of the cheapest fuel in the Americas, but which are a main cause of the nation’s fiscal crisis.
title: New Finance Chief Vows to Axe Bolivia’s Ultra Cheap Fuel Policy

author: Jennifer Duggan
description: Ireland has lifted its de-facto ban on connecting new data centers to the electricity grid around Dublin — a move that brings clarity for the industry on energy requirements for new facilities.
title: Ireland Set to End Moratorium on New Power Links to Data Centers

author: Alex Morales, Lucy White
description: Health Secretary Wes Streeting urged doctors to call off a strike planned for the run-up to Christmas, agreeing in a radio interview that it was “one minute to midnight” for the UK’s National Health Service.
title: UK Flu Surge and Doctors’ Strikes Test Streeting’s Leadership

author: Mark Niquette, Nancy Cook
description: President Donald Trump is heading into the 2026 election year vowing to pull out all the stops to promote artificial intelligence — just as American voters are starting to voice some doubts.
title: AI Is Powering Trump’s Economy, But American Voters Are Getting Worried

author: Danielle Balbi
description: Presidential frontrunner José Antonio Kast is sounding a lot like the US president.
title: Chile May Be Next to Veer to Trumpist Right

author: Antonia Mufarech, Matthew Malinowski
description: Arch-conservative José Antonio Kast is warning migrants to get out now or risk getting thrown out in an echo of Donald Trump’s harsh policies.
title: Anti-Migrant Crusader Stokes Border Tensions Ahead of Chile Vote

author: Josh Xiao, Nectar Gan
description: A member of China’s decision-making Politburo has missed two high-profile meetings in recent weeks, fueling speculation about his fate amid President Xi Jinping’s widening anti-corruption purge.
title: China Politburo Member Misses Two Key Meetings as Mystery Builds

author: Anthony Halpin
description: The Bank of Russia is taking legal action in Moscow against Euroclear over frozen state assets as it threatened the European Union with a global campaign of retaliation to recover hundreds of billions of euros if the bloc makes any use of the funds.
title: Russia Says It’s Suing Euroclear in Moscow on Frozen Assets

author: Lucy White
description: A new economic think tank linked to the UK’s Green Party is set to launch in the new year, as the left-wing party seeks to fend off criticism that it doesn’t understand the economy.
title: UK Greens Try to Get Serious on Economy as Party Climbs UK Polls

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Philip Heijmans
description: Thailand’s prime minister is gambling on early elections as a nationalist wave fueled by the border conflict with Cambodia offers his conservative bloc a chance to best pro-democracy rivals that have won every election this century.
title: Thai Premier Seizes Chance for Early Vote as Wartime Leader

author: Erica Yokoyama, Akemi Terukina, Tsuyoshi Inajima
description: Japan’s car industry union will seek a slightly more ambitious wage hike goal in the upcoming round of negotiations compared to the previous year, adding momentum to talks as the Bank of Japan tracks pay trends in the US tariffs-hit sector.
title: Japan’s Auto Union Seeks Higher Wage Gains as BOJ Watches Trends

description:
On today's show, Donald Trump signals the US could help with Ukraine's security as part of a peace deal with Russia. This as President Zelenskiy floats the prospect of a referendum on handing over land to Russia.

Broadcom shares dropped as much as 5% in late trade after its sales outlook for AI revenue failed to meet investors' lofty expectations. The company has a backlog of 73-billion-dollars in AI product orders that will be shipped over the next six quarters.

US President Donald Trump is ramping up pressure on Venezuela after seizing an oil tanker on Wednesday.

Bloomberg understands the seizure is aimed at cutting Venzuelan President Nicholas Maduro's lifeline of oil revenue. President Trump warned the US would soon be moving its focus to land. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump: US Would Help With Ukraine’s Security in Peace Deal | Daybreak Europe 12/12/2025

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: A group of civilians including two former government officials filed a graft complaint against Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte, in a fresh political challenge for the estranged deputy of President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.
title: Philippines’ Vice President Duterte Faces Fresh Graft Complaint

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Vilnius is the only European capital that allows hot-air balloons to float over the city center, making them a signature of the skyline in the summer months.
title: Putin Ally Shuts Down Lithuanian Flights With Balloon Incursions

description: Mustafa Suleyman made his name in tech when he co-founded AI lab DeepMind at age 26. Now he’s Microsoft AI’s CEO. He tells Mishal Husain about the company’s deal with OpenAI, tech’s talent war and how he winds down with Copilot. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: The Man Driving Microsoft’s New AI Strategy

author: Grace Sihombing, Norman Harsono
description: Indonesia expects to conclude a trade agreement with the US by the end of the year as pressure builds on both sides to iron out disagreements that threaten to unravel their ties.
title: Indonesia Targets Concluding Tariff Deal with US by Year End

description:
Microsoft AI's CEO Mustafa Suleyman discusses the importance of approaching the increasing capabilities of artificial intelligence with transparency, regular audits and government engagement. "Nobody wants to cause mass harm," he says. Suleyman  adds: "We all predict a time in the next five years, maybe in the next 10 years, where these capabilities do start to emerge and systems like this could set their own goals, or they could improve their own code, or they could act autonomously."
 
Listen to the full interview with Mustafa Suleyman by subscribing to The Mishal Husain Show wherever you get your podcasts. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Microsoft AI’s Suleyman Says Nobody Wants 'Mass Harm'

author: Anisah Shukry
description: The Malaysian government intends to have former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. banker Tim Leissner stand trial in the Southeast Asian nation for crimes related to state investment fund 1MDB, according to the Attorney General’s Chambers.
title: Malaysia Seeks Ex-Goldman Banker Extradition to Face 1MDB Trial

description: Former UK Prime Minister Theresa May speaks with Francine Lacqua in London about her time at the top of British politics and her approach to leadership in a world that often rewards the loudest voices and divisive content on social media. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Easier for Populism to Rise With Social Media, May Says

author: Will Standring
description: Former Prime Minister Theresa May suggested the threat to her Conservative Party posed by the poll-leading Reform UK is over-egged, saying that while Nigel Farage’s outfit “makes a lot of noise,” plenty can change before the next election.
title: Theresa May Plays Down Reform UK Threat to Tories as ‘Noise’

description:
Former UK Prime Minister Theresa May speaks with Francine Lacqua about Vladimir Putin and her approach to leadership in a world seeing a rise in "strongmen."
 (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Theresa May and the Brutality of Politics

author: John Harney, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump on Thursday signed several congressional measures designed to undo Biden administration land conservation policies restricting energy development in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge and federal lands in three Western states.
title: Trump Repeals Biden Land Protections in Alaska, Other States

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: Thailand’s armed forces said Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul’s decision to dissolve parliament won’t impact its operations against Cambodia amid a renewed border conflict.
title: Thai Military Says Border Fight Unhindered by PM’s Election Move

author: Sakura Murakami, Akemi Terukina, Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Comments made a month ago by Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi that triggered a diplomatic spat with China over Taiwan appear to have been unscripted, based on documents obtained by a lawmaker, in what could point to a misstep by the premier.
title: Takaichi Remark That Riled China Was Unscripted, Documents Show

author: Alan Wong
description: Former Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai faces a verdict on Monday in a landmark national security trial, a decision that will help define the limits of free speech in the Chinese territory and potentially strain relations with the US and UK.
title: Hong Kong to Decide on Jimmy Lai’s Security Case on Monday

description: Thai Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul dissolved parliament, setting the stage for an early election. Bloomberg's Ramsey Al-Rikabi has the latest. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Thailand Heads for Election as PM Dissolves Parliament

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: The top US commander on the Korean peninsula said regular exercises between the allies are “absolutely” necessary to maintain peace and impose pressure on North Korea after officials in Seoul floated adjusting the drills to facilitate dialogue with the nuclear-armed neighbor.
title: US General Says Drills ‘Absolutely’ Needed as Korea Floats Shift

author: Charles Gorrivan, Fiona Rutherford
description: President Donald Trump is expected to direct his administration to move to reclassify marijuana as a less dangerous drug, according to people familiar with the matter, a move that could represent one of the biggest shifts in US policy toward cannabis in decades.
title: Trump Plans to Push for Cannabis Rescheduling as Less Dangerous

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said he was pardoning Tina Peters, a former Colorado county clerk who was imprisoned after being found guilty of tampering with voting machines.
title: Trump Says He Pardoned Ex-Clerk in Prison for Election Crimes

description: Rachel VanLandingham, Southwestern Law School Professor of Law and former JAG Officer, talks about the legality of the US seizing an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela as well as their strikes against a Venezuelan boat in September, calling it a case for murder. She joins Joe Mathieu on 'Bloomberg: Balance of Power.' (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Former JAG Officer: US Needs to Prove Oil Was Smuggled

description: The US Senate rejected Democratic and Republican healthcare plans to address the expiring Affordable Care Act subsidies. Representative Gregory Meeks (D-NY) joins Joe Mathieu on 'Bloomberg: Balance of Power' to discuss the ramifications it could bring to millions of Americans who get their health insurance through the Affordable Care Act. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Crisis is Here: Rep. Meeks on Healthcare Standoff in the Senate

description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Democratic Representative of New York, Gregory Meeks, talks about the Senate rejecting both parties' healthcare plans and the ramifications it could bring to nearly 20 million Americans who rely on the Affordable Care Act for health insurance, and Rachel VanLandingham, Southwestern Law School Professor and former JAG Officer, discusses the legality of the US seizing a Venezuelan Oil Tanker as well as the US military's strike on a Venezuelan boat in September. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: White House Grilled Over Seized Oil Tanker | Balance of Power: Late Edition 12/11/2025

author: Alastair Gale
description: China isn’t contributing to the peace and stability of the Asia-Pacific region, Japanese Defense Minister Shinjiro Koizumi and US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth concurred on Friday following accusations from Tokyo that at least one Chinese fighter jet used its weapons-targeting radar on Japanese fighters.
title: Japan, US Defense Chiefs Agree China Radar Incident Damaging

author: Loukia Gyftopoulou, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump issued an executive order seeking to limit the influence of proxy advisory firms, part of a push to curtail how third-party firms attempt to sway the direction of public companies.
title: Trump Orders SEC to Review Proxy Advisor Rules in ESG Crackdown

author: Philip Aldrick
description: UK households on welfare appear to react to benefits cuts by claiming more disability payments, according to a study by the Institute for Fiscal Studies think tank that concluded ministers need to pay more attention to the knock-on effects of their policies.
title: UK Benefit Cuts Sparked Increase in Disability Claims, IFS Says

author: Joe Mayes
description: An influential panel of UK lawmakers is launching an inquiry into Britain’s fiscal watchdog, the Office for Budget Responsibility, after it came under intense scrutiny over its role in Rachel Reeves’ recent budget.
title: UK MPs Launch Inquiry Into Fiscal Watchdog After Budget Blunder

author: James Mayger
description: China’s exports are putting it on a collision course with Europe.
title: China Forces Reckoning in Europe as Trade Turns Existential
